intro: Astragalus adiyamanensis, commonly known as Adıyaman milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, globular clusters. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Astragalus adiyamanensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native region.
